title: Climate change: call in Leeds City Region (OC20R16P 0423)

body.content:
## Details

This call is looking to promote investment to address specific risks, ensure disaster resilience and develop disaster management systems.

For more information, download the [embed:attachments:inline:b05f29ba-5c2e-406a-ba5c-7a26bbd02025].

## Location
Project’s put forward under this call must cover all or part of the Leeds City Region Local Enterprise Partnership area.

## Value
Up to £1,621,334 of funding is available through this call. A minimum value of £1,000,000 can be applied for.

## Deadlines
Outline application deadline: 17 February 2017

## Completion date
It is anticipated that funding from this call will be awarded for up to 3 years.

## How to apply
To apply for funding under this call you will need to complete and send the Outline Application form to the email address provided in the call document. The guidance provides information to help you complete the form. The form and guidance can be found [here]
(https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/european-structural-and-investment-funds-outline-application). 

Please make sure that you are using the latest version of the form and guidance from our website to submit your application.

You are also advised to read the details in the call documents in order to produce an application that complies with the requirements and meets the needs set out in the Operational Programme.  All this information, the related guidance and the European Regional Development Fund Operational Programme can be found from our [home page]
(https://www.gov.uk/england-2014-to-2020-european-structural-and-investment-funds).

You may also find it helpful to see details regarding Technical Assistance projects. Details of these can be found on our [website] (https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/european-structural-and-investment-funds-technical-assistance).

## What happens next
If your outline application is successful, we’ll contact you and ask you to make a full application.

## Contact details
If you have a question, contact [YH.ERDFENQUIRIES@communities.gsi.gov.uk](mailto:YH.ERDFENQUIRIES@communities.gsi.gov.uk).

Call reference number: OC20R16P 0423

description: Call for project's promoting climate change adaptation, risk prevention and management

organisations.title: Department for Communities and Local Government
Department for Environment, Food & Rural Affairs

finder.description: Find and apply to run projects backed by ESIF
finder.title: European Structural and Investment Funds (ESIF)

details.summary:
Applies to: England (see guidance for Scotland, Wales and Northern Ireland)

Apply to run projects backed by the European Structural and Investment Fund (ESIF). ESIF includes money from the European Social Fund (ESF), European Regional Development Fund (ERDF) and European Agricultural Fund for Rural Development (EAFRD).

allowed_values.label: European Agricultural Fund for Rural Development
